title: Trump Administration Scrambles to Pick Up the Pieces of Broken Tariffs
summary: President Trump is already working to piece his tariff program back together, after a Supreme Court ruling ruptured a centerpiece of his economic agenda.

title: Trump-Appointed Judge Bars Release of Jack Smith’s Report in Documents Case
summary: Judge Aileen Cannon, a Trump-appointed federal judge in Florida, slammed the former special counsel, Jack Smith, for drafting the report even after she had dismissed the case.

title: Judges Grow Angry Over Trump Administration Violating Their Orders
summary: At least 35 times since August, federal judges have ordered the administration to explain why it should not be punished for violating their orders in immigration cases.

title: ‘Angel Families’ Return to Washington to Back Up Trump Ahead of State of the Union
summary: The families of people killed by undocumented immigrants have forged a bond with the president, who has invited some of them to his address on Tuesday.

title: C.I.A. Intelligence Helped Lead Mexican Authorities to ‘El Mencho’
summary: Mexican officials said they had found the elusive cartel kingpin by tracking a romantic partner. The C.I.A. provided some intelligence critical to the operation.

title: Mexican Forces Say They Tracked El Mencho to Cabin by Following His Lover
summary: Top security officials revealed details of the operation that led to the death of Mexico’s most wanted drug cartel leader.

title: What Travelers Need to Know as Cartel Violence Rattles Mexico
summary: The killing of a drug lord and the unrest that followed have prompted flight cancellations, roadblocks, cruise disruptions and “shelter in place” alerts.

title: Snow Day! What It Looks Like When New York City Comes Out to Play.
summary: Across the five boroughs, New Yorkers sledded and frolicked, but the best moments were when the city stood still.

title: Peter Attia Leaves CBS News Amid Epstein Files Fallout
summary: Emails showed that the longevity influencer had provided medical advice to Jeffrey Epstein and had made crude comments about women.

title: U.K. Police Arrest Peter Mandelson, Ex-Ambassador to the U.S., Amid Epstein Accusations
summary: Peter Mandelson was arrested on Monday on suspicion of “misconduct in public office” following revelations about his dealings with Jeffrey Epstein, the sex offender.

title: The Evolution of Eyes Began With One
summary: Even Charles Darwin was puzzled by the evolution of the vertebrate eye. New research suggests that it traces back to a cyclopean invertebrate with a single eye atop the head.

title: Witness Who Disputed ICE Account of Ruben Ray Martinez Shooting Dies in Car Accident
summary: A passenger in the car with Ruben Ray Martinez wrote that the men were trying to comply with authorities before Mr. Martinez was shot. The passenger, Joshua Orta, died in a car accident on Saturday.

title: ‘Survivor’ Is America
summary: It’s our greatest game and our truest mirror. And in its tiki-torch-festooned way, it’s captured our society as an ever-changing collection of tribes.

title: Binance Employees Find $1.7 Billion in Crypto Was Sent to Iranian Entities
summary: Binance pledged to crack down on crime. But internal investigators at the world’s largest crypto exchange continued to find evidence of potential legal violations on the platform.

title: Prince William and Kate Made a Pointed Appearance at BAFTA
summary: After Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor’s arrest, the Prince and Princess of Wales made a pointed BAFTA appearance.

title: After Saks Bankruptcy, Richard Baker Says He Saved Luxury Department Stores
summary: Richard Baker wanted to create a retail empire when he combined Saks Fifth Avenue and Neiman Marcus. About a year later, it filed for bankruptcy.

title: Texas Lt. Governor Says Camp Mystic Shouldn’t Receive License to Reopen
summary: Separately, a lawsuit filed Monday asserted that Texas officials shared blame in the flood disaster that killed 27 girls last summer.

title: Settlers in the Israeli-Occupied West Bank Drive a Palestinian Family Off Its Land
summary: For two years, settlers attacked Rezeq Abu Naim’s land in the Israeli-occupied West Bank at all hours and in all manners. After another violent incursion over the weekend, his family abandoned their home.

title: New York Democrats Have a Chance to Vote Against the A.I. Oligarchs
summary: There’s a huge political opportunity for the party that can stand up for human beings in the face of A.I.

title: An Autonomous OpenClaw Chatbot Wanted Revenge
summary: An autonomous OpenClaw chatbot seeks revenge.

title: Mexico Is on Edge After the Killing of a Cartel Boss
summary: Also, a blizzard sweeps through the Northeast. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: BAFTAs Guest With Tourettes Shouts Racial Slur During Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo’s Appearance
summary: A racist slur, shouted involuntarily while Michael B. Jordan and Delroy Lindo were presenting an award, raised questions about how the show’s host and the BBC responded.

title: Canada to Probe What OpenAI Knew About Tumbler Ridge Shooter
summary: The company suspended the killer’s ChatGPT account over a policy violation in June, eight months before the attacks in Tumbler Ridge, British Columbia.

title: Nick Reiner Pleads Not Guilty in the Killing of His Parents
summary: Mr. Reiner, 32, was charged with murdering his parents, the Hollywood director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner, last year.

title: Anthropic Accuses 3 Chinese Companies of Harvesting Its Data
summary: The San Francisco start-up claimed that DeepSeek, Moonshot and MiniMax used approximately 24,000 fraudulent accounts to train their own chatbots.
